iseplib.classes

Class PyArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • iseplib.classes.PyArray

  • public class PyArray
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a way of simulating Python lists in Java.
    Version:
    1.0.0 Jan 17, 2020
    Author:
    Barbatos Rex

      The constructor of the class for a non null set of elements.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        public int length()
        This method calculates the length of the PyArray.
        Returns:
        The length of the PyArray.

      • condenser

        public java.lang.String[] condenser(java.lang.String[] arr,
                                    int newLen,
                                    java.lang.String[] list)
        This method reduces the length of the list to its number of non null elements. Also this method can be used for external condensing.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be condensed.
        newLen - The new length of the array.
        list - The original list of values to provide the number of null elements it has.
        Returns:
        The newly formed array with non null positions removed.

      • append

        public void append(java.lang.String str)
        This method inserts an item in the end of the list.
        Parameters:
        str - The item to be inserted.

      • print

        public void print()
        This method prints the array in Python form: [element1,element2,...,elementn] for an n length array.

      • pop

        public void pop(int index)
        This method removes an item from any position of the vector.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the element to be removed.

      • pop

        public void pop()
        This method removes the last item in the list.

      • invert

        public void invert()
        This method inverts the items in the vector/array.

      • insert

        public void insert(java.lang.String vallue,
                   int index)
        This method allows to place an element in a chosen index, making all elements whose indexes are greater than it being pushed one index away.
        Parameters:
        vallue - The element you want to insert.
        index - The position/index you want it to be inserted. Ex: {1,2,4,5} insert("3","2") -> {1,2,3,4,5}.

      • sort

        public void sort()
        A simple method to sort the items/elements in the list,

      • setVallues

        public void setVallues(java.lang.String[] list)
        This method allows the array to assume another list.
        Parameters:
        list - New list to the array assume.

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo(java.lang.String[] arr)
        This method compares the list with an array to see if the are equal.
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to be compared with the list.
        Returns:
        If the list is equal to an array, which means if every singe element is equal and is in the same position.

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo(PyArray arr)
        This method compares the list with another one to see if the are equal.
        Parameters:
        arr - The list to be compared with the list.
        Returns:
        If the list is equal to another list, which means if every singe element is equal and is in the same position.

      • index

        public int index(java.lang.String key)
        This method returns the position of an item of the list.
        Parameters:
        key - The item to be searched.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of the element of the list or -1 if non existent.
